sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects specific windows registry modifications made by BlackByte ransomware variants.
BlackByte set three different registry values to escalate privileges and begin setting the stage for lateral movement and encryption.
This rule triggers when any of the following registry keys are set to DWORD 1, however all three should be investigated as part of a larger BlackByte ransomware detection and response effort.
Detect the use of "sc.exe" to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "demand"
Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions
Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets
Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Disable Windows Defender Functionalities Via Registry Keys
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when attackers or tools disable Windows Defender functionalities via the Windows registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: AlertIQ, Jn Trencansk, frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects specific windows registry modifications made by BlackByte ransomware variants.
BlackByte set three different registry values to escalate privileges and begin setting the stage for lateral movement and encryption.
This rule triggers when any of the following registry keys are set to DWORD 1, however all three should be investigated as part of a larger BlackByte ransomware detection and response effort.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Activate Suppression of Windows Security Center Notifications
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect set Notification_Suppress to 1 to disable the Windows security center notification
Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets
Detect the use of "sc.exe" to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "demand"
Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
